data.title: John C. Fremont Library events and programs
data.meta_description: John C. Fremont Library events and programs— June’s Featured Artist is Brian Tate of Cañon City. He will display his landscape photos of the Midwest and Colorado. Tate and his wife, Michelle, are the owners and innkeepers of the Jewel of the Canyons Bed and Breakfast in Cañon City.— “The Tunnels Under Our Feet: Colorado’s […]
data.text:
— June’s Featured Artist is Brian Tate of Cañon City. He will display his landscape photos of the Midwest and Colorado. Tate and his wife, Michelle, are the owners and innkeepers of the Jewel of the Canyons Bed and Breakfast in Cañon City.

— “The Tunnels Under Our Feet: Colorado’s Forgotten Hollow Sidewalks” will be at 7 p.m. June 11. Author Tracy Beach will discuss the history of the tunnels under the sidewalks and streets of many Colorado cities including Florence, Cañon City, Salida and Durango. Her book will be available for purchase with check or cash.

— “Women of the Wild West” will be at 7 p.m. June 16. Local historian Kathy Herrin will talk about many of the extraordinary and ordinary women of the west who made and changed history.

— “Thursday Night at the Movies” will be at 7 p.m. June 25. The movie is “Wild,” based on Cheryl Strayed’s book. It is about her trek across the Pacific Crest Trail. Starring Reece Witherspoon. Rated R. Free popcorn — bring your own drink.

— “Ranger Dave’s Colorado Trail Backpack” will be at 7 p.m. June 30. Dave Van Manen, the founder and special projects coordinator for the Mountain Park Environmental Center in Beulah, presents an acoustic concert and slide show. Ranger Dave’s program includes inspiring stories from the Colorado Trail with live music and beautiful photographs of Colorado’s mountain scenery.

John C. Fremont Library is located at 130 Church Ave. in Florence. For more information, call 784-4649, email Natalia.Gray@JCFLD.org or visit JCFLD.org.

Top of the World Rodeo coming to Cripple Creek

Presented by the City of Cripple Creek, Top of the World Rodeo, the highest elevation rodeo in the world, brings a weekend of thrilling rodeo action June 12-14 to Teller County Fairgrounds in Cripple Creek.

The rodeo weekend kicks off June 12, with the Ames Construction Percheron Horse Team at Bronco Billy’s Casino, followed by the “Kick Off Hootenanny” at Wildwood Casino with 8-time World Champion Cowboy Larry Mahan, and country band Trucker’s Daughter featuring Lynn Groom, plus a mechanical bull, horseshoes and other fun games.

June 13 is a day full of events starting with a pancake breakfast, a western parade down Bennett Avenue and the first day of Mutton Busting and Colorado Professional Rodeo Association (CPRA) competition. The CPRA Rodeo will feature all of the rodeo events, including Bull Riding and Barrel Racing, appearances by Larry Mahan, the Ames Construction Percheron Horse Team, Pikes Peak Rangerettes, Sweethearts of the West and more. That evening, meet Larry Mahan at the Double Eagle Casino and kick up your boots at the western street dance at Brass Ass Casino.

June 14 starts with a second pancake breakfast and Cowboy Church with Pastor Mark Cartwright. Mutton Busting and the CPRA Rodeo competition continue on Sunday with a second performance, including celebrity and specialty act appearances. After the rodeo on Sunday, a team-roping jackpot will begin, challenging area team ropers to a great local competition.

Daily Record Staff
